cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northwest through Sunday, then turn WNW, cross or skirt the northern Yucatan late Monday, reach the central Gulf as a hurricane Tuesday, and accelerate northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then into the Tennessee Valley and toward the Mid-Atlantic states by Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (likely southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only for Pinar del Rio, Cuba (far from Virginia).
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this time.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatan Peninsula, north-central Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama, then inland across Mississippi, Alabama, Tennessee Valley and eventually the Mid-Atlantic including Virginia.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 1–3 inches for coastal Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds (generally below tropical-storm force) possible late 29–30 Oct as the weakening system moves through.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast with present forecast track and intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain possible Thursday night into Friday, potentially producing 1–3 inches and brief visibility restrictions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated minor coastal flooding and elevated waves possible if the remnant low exits into the Atlantic east of the port.
